newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK's Wing Lee to raise HK$70 mln in IPO - sources.
newsitem.headline: HK's Wing Lee to raise HK$70 mln in IPO - sources.

text.p: Hong Kong-based switch and socket maker Wing Lee Holdings Ltd is expected to raise HK$70 million in an initial public offering (IPO) of shares in April to fund production expansion, market sources said on Friday.
The company is expected to issue 70 million new shares, or 25 percent of the enlarged share capital, at HK$1.00 each in the IPO, sources said.
The issue price will represent a price-earnings multiple of six to seven times and the company is expected to have market capitalisation of HK$280 million, sources said.
Wing Lee is expected to hold a company presentation next week before it kicks off its IPO in early April, they said.
Sources said proceeds were expected to be used to buy new machinery to upgrade and expand production capacity.
"The company forecasts a net profit of HK$40 million for the year ending in September 1997," one source said.
Lippo Securities is expected to be the sponsor of the issue, they said. Lippo officials were not immediately available for comment.
